intro: Brayera anthelmintica var. epirhagadotricha, commonly known as the hairy brayera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which contribute to its unique appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
